title: 109_hr5413
content: The Act aims to improve the codification of title 46, United States Code, by incorporating public comments and amendments made after the cutoff date specified in a previous bill. It specifically addresses personal injury to or death of seamen. The Act aims to improve the codification of title 46, United States Code by addressing personal injury or death of seamen through amendments to Section 30104 and Chapter 537. The amendments provide seamen the right to bring actions for injury or death under US laws, with the option of admiralty or trial by jury, and specify venue for legal actions. The Act makes amendments to title 46, United States Code, including redesignating paragraphs and defining terms like Administrator and Secretary. It also prioritizes certain vessels in guaranteeing obligations under the chapter. The Act amends Section 53706(c) of title 46, US Code, prioritizing vessels eligible for guarantees, giving preference to those constructed with assistance under the Maritime Security Act of 2003 and those suitable for naval auxiliary service in times of war or national emergency.
